data.title: Building Technical Codes
data.meta_description: The City of Austin's Building Technical Codes (Chapter 25-12), contains regulations for Building, Electric, Fire, Property Maintenance, Mechanical, Plumbing, Residential, and Solar Energy. The City of Austin follows the 2021 International Building Code.
data.text:
The City of Austin's Building Technical Codes (Chapter 25-12) contains regulations for Building, Electric, Fire, Property Maintenance, Mechanical, Plumbing, Residential, and Solar Energy.

Local Amendments

2021 Local Amendments became effective September 1, 2021. Learn more about the Approved 2021 Technical Code Changes.

Click below to view the local amendments for each Code.

Local Amendment

Current

Flood Hazard Areas - (Chapter 25-12, Article 3) 2021 International Building Code (IBC) 2021 International Energy Conservation Code (IECC) 2021 International Existing Building Code (IEBC) 2021 International Fire Code (IFC) 2021 International Property Maintenance Code (IPMC) 2021 International Residential Code (IRC) 2021 International Swimming Pool and Spa Code (ISPSC) 2018 International Wildland-Urban Interface Code (IWUIC) 2015 National Electrical Code (NEC) 2023 Uniform Mechanical Code (UMC) 2021 Uniform Plumbing Code (UPC) 2021

Historic Code Adoption Dates (PDF)

For more information about proposed 2024 Technical Building Code amendments, visit our Technical Codes engagement page.

Technical Code Interpretations

The Code Interpretation Library provides useful information on how the City interprets and applies certain regulations in the Land Development Code (Title 25 of the City Code), including site development and subdivision regulations, as well as technical (construction) codes.

Accessible Pathway and Accessible Parking (CI2011-0002) (PDF)

Assisted Use Toilets Enforcement (CI2014-0002) (PDF)

Applicability of Worker Protection Standards (CI2019-0001) (PDF)
